description:
Job Title: Production Manager

Duration: 3 month Contact

Location: Hybrid in Beverly Hills, CA


Company Overview: Our client is the leading independent services division of a music group, offering a comprehensive range of artist and label services globally. Their services include Production, Distribution, Marketing, Promotion, Commercial Marketing, Brand/Synch & Licensing, Lifestyle Marketing, and more.


Role Overview: The Production Department at this corporation is at the heart of product planning and production, managing a diverse array of formats, strategies, and deals for our artist and label clients through the supply chains. This role is essential in fostering our team culture and delivering the “white glove” service ethos we are known for. You'll be working closely with artists, managers, and teams throughout the lifecycle of a campaign, ensuring excellence in product setup, milestone tracking, planning, scheduling, and catalog management.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Metadata & Asset Management: Receive, review, and refine raw metadata and assets from clients before submission into supply chain systems.
  • Release Submission: Create and submit releases into digital supply chains, ensuring all metadata and asset standards are met.
  • Timeline Management: Ensure all submission lead time requirements are met in alignment with project timelines.
  • Issue Mitigation: Anticipate and address technical and operational issues, working closely with clients, operational teams, and other stakeholders to mitigate risks.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Maintain clear communication with the production team, clients, and internal stakeholders regarding project status, operational activities, and issue resolution.
  • Process Improvement: Collaborate with production team members to develop processes that enhance efficiency, client experience, and coordination with other teams.
  • Expectation Management: Help manage client and interdepartmental expectations regarding the feasibility of requests, system capabilities, and standard operating procedures.
  • Risk Assessment: Provide insights on when and where special exceptions can be deployed for maximum impact with minimal risk.
  • Supply Chain Coordination: Work with supply chain and operations teams to resolve technical and issues on critical projects.
  • Physical Production Oversight: Oversee the planning, production, and timelines for physical releases in coordination with clients and internal teams.
  • Vendor Coordination: Manage the delivery of physical release elements to manufacturing vendors.
  • System Development Participation: Actively contribute as an expert stakeholder in system development and process improvement initiatives.
  • Catalog Management: Collaborate with the catalog migration team on incoming artist catalogs that will be under your management.
  • Team Support: Provide backup coverage for team members and contribute to special projects and broader business initiatives.
